entry.title: Rizal Monument (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that while other countries built monuments to José Rizal a century after his birth, the Rizal Monument (pictured) in Madrid was built a century after his death?

entry.title: Majidreza Rahnavard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Majidreza Rahnavard was the first Iranian to be executed in public in connection with the Mahsa Amini protests?

entry.title: Southern Railway 1401 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Southern Railway 1401 was one of eight locomotives that hauled the funeral train of U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt?

entry.title: Henrietta Bruckman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Henrietta Bruckman founded the first fraternal organization for Jewish women in the United States?

entry.title: a 1916 act of Parliament (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that only one person made a donation of land for the settlement and employment of British military veterans under a 1916 act of Parliament?

entry.title: Valentín Carboni (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Valentín Carboni played in the same three youth teams as his brother Franco before they both received their first call-up to the Argentine senior national team in March 2022?

entry.title: held their local newspaper hostage (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that two Tuscarora men held their local newspaper hostage in an attempt to expose local police corruption, to no avail?

entry.title: Phil Fletcher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Phil Fletcher as Hacker T. Dog caused Lauren Layfield to make the "most famous snort" in the United Kingdom in 2016?
